CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in New Pittsburgh Courier newspaper September 19, 1970, pg 33, reads: "Knights of Peter Claver Meet - Eligia L. McCoy, right, who is an official of the Knights of Peter Claver, was a visitor in Pittsburgh recently.  Mr. McCoy, of Detroit Mich. is an Assistant Deputy of the organization's Northern District.  He met here with officers and members of St. Bridgid's St. Benedict's Council 157, Knights of Peter Claver, to promote unity among the various councils which make up the Northern District.  Others in the pictures are, reading from left, Martin Davis, Treasurer, Frank Knight, Franklin Jerry; Alan Stewart, recording secretary; Monsignor Bassompierre, chaplain, and Eligia McCoy was accompanied by his wife, Jamesetta on his trip to Pittsburgh.  She is National Junior Daughter Counsellor of the Knights of Peter Claver."
TitMainTitle: Martin Davis, Frank Knight, Franklin Jerry, Alan Stewart, Monsignor Paul Bassompierre, and Elgia McCoy seated at tables for Knights of Peter Claver meeting
